name: Sofitel Athens Airport

reviews.text: Best location for transfer or early morning flights. Modern, well maintened house with great service. The staff were pleasant and freiendly in all situations. We had a nice upgrade upon our arrival. The room was spacious and extremly comfy with clean and modern bathroom. Good food in the restaurant however not cheap. Great breakfast. Definitely I will stay again there.
reviews.title: Great property

reviews.text: Everything about this hotel worked for us. A 6:45 am flight meant being at the airport by 5:00 am - woke up at 4:30 very rested and ready for the day! Will stay here whenever necessary - early booking rates made it reasonably priced as well.
reviews.title: If you have an early flight this is the place.

reviews.text: Stayed for one night, while I was in Athens for a conference at Metropolitan Expo, which is very close to the hotel. The room was big, the hotel staff was very professional and although it is located next to the airport, you couldn't hear anything... I liked the fact that you could check flight departures and arrivals through the monitors that are located at the main lobby, and in the room also via your TV set!!
reviews.title: Excellent business stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the best airport hotel we've stayed at: spacious and luxurious rooms and amenities, including a beautiful indoor rooftop pool and spa. The airport in Athens is a long way from town, and this was the perfect solution for an early flight--it's at the airport subway stop across the street (55 yards) from the airport. Our only criticism: breakfast was not included and was pricey (though we left too early to have it anyway).
reviews.title: Superb, very convenient airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 1 night pre-cruise and great to walk just across the road for hotel after a long flight. Also glad we decided to stay at Airport as downtown Athens a mess with riots and no taxi service due to strikes. Staff very apologetic for limited restaurant services and upgraded to a great room. Best hotel beds ever, immaculately clean room and no noise whatsoever from planes. Didn't even hear any internal noise.
reviews.title: First Class for Comfort, Airport Location and Convenience
a truly "Wow" Comfy bed!
reviews.text: If you need to overnight in Athens without going into the City, this is the place to stay. We arrived the day before a cruise and wanted the convenience of being able to walk to the hotel. By staying at this hotel, you literally walk in the crosswalk across the street from the baggage claim area about 150 feet and you are at the hotel. Hotel is very nice, beds are INCREDIBLE! Amzing sheets with comfortable nice down duvets, and a choice of pillows. They advertise the beds as being like a cocoon and theyare more comfortable than any others I have slept in. Blissful! . Room also has a safe, plush robes and slippers. One complimentary small bottle of water is provided. Room has nice bathroom with a huge walk in glass shower and tub. L'Occitane Shampoo, body lotion and bath gel provided, but no hair conditioner or shower cap, so bring your own if needed. As another reviewer my only complaint was the lack of hair conditioner and that breakfast was not included in the cost of the room. Very friendly staff. There are restaurants in the airport if you don't want to eat at the hotel. We ate a snack in the bar at night with delectable twice fried chips and a very fresh Greek salad. We ate the mid range breakfast for 12 Euros and were able to choose from a very wide range of bakery products, cheeses, meets, fruits and yoghurts plus as much coffee as required. We had booked a private transfer through Viator - which was seamless. Hotel also gives you 15 min. of free internet on their lobby computer. Spa/indoor pool area also - although we investigated we didnt use it.. There was absolutely NO noise from the airport and we had a room facing the airport. Nor was there any light, so much so that when you wake up it could be any time of day! We had a great stay and will definitely stay here again if we ever need a hotel in Athens before or after a cruise. The only downside was watching the obvious poverty on the trip to the ship .........and the news...

Stayed for 1 night in a trip to Athens. First time at a Sofitel although I heard Good things about the brand. Check-in was excellent and the location to the terminal is very very easy and across the road from arrivals. The room was incredibly spacious and very comfortable bed. Great views from the hotel room window. The bathroom was a delight. Incredibly powerful shower with fantastic toiletries. Was pleased to realise that I received an upgrade on my room. The hotel restaurant had a great selection of food and drinks. The bar was also good. Free Wi-Fi throughout is a bonus. Did not use the gym and leisure facilities but did take a look and they looked a very high standard.
reviews.title: Great airport hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The airport provide easy access into Athens city centre by train and bus. The train was only every 30 minutes and beware to not miss the last train back from the city centre otherwise you will have to take a taxi which we did and it was very expensive.
reviews.title: Excellent Value and Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel if you are in Athens for a short time and need easy access to the airport, otherwise if you are going to be staying at things for longer than a few nights, you might as well stay in the city because the transports links are not cheap and I'm not frequently enough to warrant staying at the hotel for a longer period of time. I would definitely recommend this Hotel and look forward staying at another Sofitel in the near future.
reviews.title: Great Airport location- Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: Depending on the traveler's needs, this can be an excellent choice. First, it's the ONLY hotel at the Athens airport. Directly across the street from the terminal. All other 'airport' hotels are a cab ride away. It is a very pretty property, rooms well appointed and clean. Nice restaurant/bar area. It is a 3 minute walk to the light rail station, about 25-30 minutes into town, fare is 8 euros. We received a very competitive internet rate when we booked, but book early. The staff was very attentive and polite, speaking excellent English. This is nothing to say that this is not a first class hotel.
reviews.title: Good choice

reviews.text: The major plus for this hotel is that it is located at the airport, avoiding the need for a trip back into town.
reviews.title: Overpriced for what you get

reviews.text: However, you pay a premium for the experience. The rooms are acceptable - nothing that special - on the European small size.
reviews.title: Comfortable, convenient
Excellent service
reviews.text: The inside swimming pool was small. The ventilation system failed to remove the strong chlorine smell in the room.

This hotel really impressed me. It was a real 4 star hotel literally a few steps away from the Athens airport terminal. I loved my room. It was stylish and very comfortable, with all amenities. Even though the building is between the terminal and an outer runway, the room was dead-quiet. Keeping in mind that the airport is 35km away from downtown Athens, and there are only a couple of 2-3 star hotels several kilometers away, this is a great choice, though not cheap, if you don't need to go into the city.
reviews.title: Style and comfort
Convenience and comfort
reviews.text: When you have an early morning flight from Athens, you can't beat the location of the Sofitel located at the airport. Service is outstanding, food is great, the beds are comfortable. I will stay there again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sofitel Hotel is the most convenient hotel that you can possibly stay at if you have an early flight. (If you do not have an early flight, then I suggest staying at the Acropolis View Hotel in Athens. Please see my review of it.) There are not any other hotels that are very close to the airport and even the ones that are will require you to take a taxi which will be expensive.
reviews.title: Cannot get any closer to the airport

reviews.text: It is a bit expensive, but it also gives you the quality of room that you would expect to get with an expensive room.
reviews.title: Worth every cent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in late August for 1 night after an exhausting trip from Sydney with a 14 month old! We were travelling on the next day to our island destination and although we have family in Athens chose to stay close to the airport. All I can say is it is worth every cent! 1 night in this hotel and their magic beds made our long-haul flight seem like a distant memory! I highly recommend this hotel for anyone stopping over in Athens! The service from the staff is excellent and the location perfect....just grab your suitcases and head across the road!
reviews.title: Comfortable Stay
A hefty price but the convenience is great for transit
reviews.text: This hotel is steps from the airport-- in fact you just cross the street and you're there. There are even airport carts at the lobby to help you make the 3 minute crossing. The hotel is unremarkable and rooms are very small -but clean and comfortable. The swimming pool is small but indoors so all-seasons. The lobby bar is a good place to get a drink and have a snack although it is a limited menu. The rate for the hotel seems high for a basic airport hotel (i think it was 200 euros!) but if you know that it is 50+ euros to get to downtown Athens and a good 60 minutes at times, it is actually worth the price and convenience. Plus if you want to get to Athens, you can take the clean and efficient public train which leaves just next door from the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reviews for this hotel are true. Luxury from start to finish and a really attentive, friendly staff who could not do enough for you. Beds are very comfortable. Food was excellent though pricey. A glass of wine 6 euros, although could get a bottle of Greek wine for 13 euros. Worth the money. Great spa area on 9th floor. When you consider how expensive taxis to the airport are - it makes this hotel on the airport's doorstep worth coosidering.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay - smashing hotel

reviews.text: Excellent stay-over at Athens Sofitel. 10 seconds from the airport, provides comfort and relaxation until your next connection. Personnel is extremely cordial and helpful. The rooms are well furnished with all amenities one requires. Compared to other hotels in Europe it gets thumps up for the cost compared to what it offers.
reviews.title: One night stop Athens airport

reviews.text: Book due to late arrival so impressed I have now booked for a 2night stay before I leave Athens.The room was just luxury,the bed was so comfy the staff extremely friendly.The convience of been a 5 minute walk if that and as a solo traveller felt very safe
reviews.title: Late night arrival

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a magnificent hotel, in an airport? well, across the road literally. walk out of arrivals and you are there..the restaurant is fine for a smorgasboard lunch...what we liked was we only had 2 courses and they charged accordingly. The staff are very good. We had dinner there on the top floor "Karavi restaurant' for one of the most unexpected wonderful restaurants ever! Who would expect this at an airport? If you need to stay for a stopover this is definately the place. Having said that the prices are very expensive.
reviews.title: We love staying here

reviews.text: A perfect place to stay between two flights and so easy to reach. Room is clean so far and comfortable, but certainly it needs a renovation or a re-launch. Especially the bathroom. A plus is the separate room for the toilet. But maintenance in the room, also in the hallway and at the ground floor bar is needed. Staff was extremely friendly and very helpful, especially the concierge to order tickets for the National Theatre. Prices for Dinner (ground floor restaurant) were a bit high, but worth it. Breakfast and water is overpriced.
reviews.title: The right place to stay near the airport

reviews.text: Walk right out door number 3 across a walkway and you are in the hotel. No noise at all from aircraft. Staff is very friendly. The room was nice. Very comfortable bed. Due to my business being out at the airport, this was perfect for me. In late on a Monday evening, Business meeting all day Tuesday and out Wednesday. checked out and walked across the walkway right into the airport. very convenient. When I have to return, this is where I'll stay again.
reviews.title: Ecellant Hotel, very convenient access to the Airport.
Convenient, Friendly, and Tasteful
reviews.text: This is an excellent airport hotel. Right across the street from the main terminal, with friendly personnel, modern architecture and ambiance, and excellent cuisine. Very comfortable, large beds, that occupy most of the room. Excellent bath and shower facilities. Breakfast is expensive, but optional and can be avoided by use of the numerous food places at the airport. Those who have lunch or dinner at the hotel will enjoy the quality of the menu.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for one night during our honeymoon in between flights from Athens to Santorini. It was perfect as it is just across the quiet road from the airport. The staff were very nice and we were upgraded upon arrival. We would definitely stay here again if we needed to be close to the airport.
reviews.title: Perfect airport hotel

reviews.text: Due to the strikes happening in Athens at the time, I was forced to stay here to ensure I got on my plane the following day. Although at first i thought the price was a little high, I had changed my mind once we got into our room. Simply described as pure delight, the room was clean, the bed was heaven and the food was amazing. I would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
Great place
reviews.text: Great place to stay, the staff was friendly and accommodated me when I arrived 3 hours before check-in. Then they upgraded me to a deluxe room for free. Very nice, just a few steps from the airport and right next to the train to get into Athens.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I decided to try the Sofitel due to a recent stop over flight through Athens airport.
reviews.title: a good choice

reviews.text: The hotel is located conveniently across the street from the arrival terminal. Check-in was efficient and friendly and my a-club elite membership status was immediately recognized by the check-in staff and resulted in a room upgrade.
reviews.title: Stranded in Athens, Saved by Sofitel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel itself has some years on its back and the design of the lobby slightly shows this both color scheme, design, furnishings and lighting. The hallways and elevators unfortunately also have a faint smell of smoke. Other than that all the public areas appear to be well maintained and clean.
reviews.title: Good hotel, but overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our upgraded deluxe room was large and spacious. Just like the lobby the color scheme, design and furnishings of the room show the age of the hotel. However everything was well maintained and appeared to be clean. The large bathroom had both a separate WC and shower and bathtub as well as a separate powder room so in other words the bathroom was a nice feature of the room.
reviews.title: Great airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sleeping comfort was high thanks to the comfortable and large bed and the room was well insulated and there was no noise or sound whatsoever from the airport outside.
reviews.title: Is it worth the price?

reviews.text: Great place to stay, although a little far from the major attractions. Breakfasts have been the best ever.
reviews.title: Pricey yet satisfying

reviews.text: The Sofitel Athens Airport Hotel is steps away from the airport's main entrance. The staff is efficient, courtesy and helpful. The beds are to die for - - expecially after traveling on a long flight or ferry ride. The hotel is spotless, quiet, secure, has 24 hr. room service, a restaurant on the ground floor which is open 24 hrs., a bar, and courtesy desk which helps with flight check-in. I visited in June and October 2011, and was very pleased with all services.
reviews.title: Love it! Love it! Love it!

reviews.text: unexpected stopover at sofitel for 2 nights due to strike action of air controllers. Rooms very comfortable. Staff very nice and friendly throughout the Hotel. It was convenient having flight boards at the hotel to keep us informed. Also very convenient to go to airport to see airline desks.Very nice place to stay.
reviews.title: friendly port in a storm

reviews.text: My dad and I stayed here overnight on our way to Kythira, Greece. We were really excited due to the high rating on here and how Sofitel is known for being a "luxury hotel." Man oh man were we disappointed. the lady who was checking us in barely spoke any english and kept talking to us in Greek. I understand that is their language, but when you work at the ONLY hotel at the airport I suggest putting people on who speak different languages. Once we had muddled through our check-in we went to check out the room. relatively big, soft beds. marble bathroom (bad idea). we then headed back to the airport to have dinner at the olive tree (like many of you suggested) and grabbed some yummy-looking pastries from the bakery on the first floor of the airport. I wanted to send an email to my family saying we made it to Athens safely, so I went on their wi-fi network to find out we only had 15 minutes of access. more than that was some ridiculous fee (maybe 18 euro, I don't really remember). So, we found that cheap and tacky. Next, we went up to the spa/pool for a swim. it was nice, but rather small and bland. full children splashing around, even due to the late hour of the day. when we were done we went back to the room and both wanted to shower and go to bed. Dad goes first and heads to bed since it is late. I go next and I need to do things like shave my legs. I sit down on the seat that is in the shower and there is a brown slimy mould everywhere in the shower/tub area. it was revolting! (I'll post pictures) I wanted to change rooms but due to the late hour (11pm) and my dad already asleep I decided it would be best to talk to the front desk staff in the morning. I talked to the front desk staff in the morning and he was SO unbelievably rude (his name was nikolas I think). he said there was nothing he could do and did not understand how inconvenient it would be to change rooms at 11pm at night. He said there was NOTHING he could do, even though I was visibly upset. he didn't even try to offer us free breakfast. he didn't even bother giving us an apology. I expect much better service and standards from a "luxury hotel" it is disgusting and I plan on writing to the company to complain about the staff and the lack of cleaning standards. NOT impressed. stay here if you must, but you won't get what you paid for. :(
reviews.title: NOT a luxury hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on our way out of Athens. The hotel is very nice, super clean, and comfortable.
reviews.title: Great hotel, amazing convenience, friendly staff

description: The Sofitel Athens Airport is located opposite the Athens International Airport, 10 km from museums, 35 minutes from Athens city center, and adjacent to the Attica Road junction for quick and easy access to any part of Athens. Enjoy a unique experience of both convenience and five-star luxury, in a blend of warm hospitality, modern surroundings, impeccable service and the latest technology. Gourmet restaurant, 24-hour food service, 2 bars and numerous facilities for both business and leisure.
